page.title: 20 ******TRANSPORT******
page.content: Willington is situated around a cross-roads. The roads which cross are the A5132 ,which runs between Willington and Swarkestone, and the B5008,which goes between Willington(A38) and Repton village. Running parallel to the B5008 is the A38 Trunk Road between Derby and Birmingham. In addition two sets of railway lines pass through Willington: (a) the Derby-Uttoxeter line, and (b) the Derby-Birmingham line passing through Burton-on-Trent. In years past Willington was a busy calling point on the canal system of England and the Trent and Mersey canal passes through the village. The canal today has no trade purpose at all. It is merely a stopping point or rest stop for tourist's canal cruisers.
